website_summaries.verdict: Great price for a standard-size light box. Made primarily for tracing and drawing rather than for multiple purposes.
pros: Features 21 LED bulbs, so you'll receive an even lighting surface without dark spots
Very thin light box, measuring about 0.14" thick
With dimensions equal to an A4 paper size, you should be able to fit this light box into a backpack for portability
cons: Uses an internal diffuser, which may dim the light too much for certain uses

customer_reviews.title: fragile port/cord issue dealt with
customer_reviews.text: Just received so time will tell but I have tried many of these LED trim light boards from other companies (one just arrived and didn't work off the bat) and find they all stop working after 12 or so times b/c the port is so fragile.This company has troubleshooted the issues with the port by adding an extension piece which is amazing. They actually troubleshooted their product which sadly is so rare theses days!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B.

customer_reviews.title: USELESS - light blocked by internal mask,
customer_reviews.text: The "special built in filter" mentioned in the description blocks so much light that this thing is USELESS - a black mask, inside the plastic that allows light to come through only tiny holes. See the included photograph of a portion of one corner, taken at the "brightest" setting. I really wanted to like this thing, contacted the Manufacturer and got a nice "Thank you for your interest" - but no answer to my question, I'm posting this here as a warning, and also to find out if someone has a suggestion how it might be made to work.
customer_reviews.author: Oly, California

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, competitively priced light table. Must provide own usb plug.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the lighttable, but there are a couple faults. It must be plugged in to use- you can’t charge it and use it remotely. It gets brighter after a minute or so of warm up. It’s LED, but it’s not as bright as the traditional plug in/regular bulb light tables. It also does not come with a plug. It’s s usb cord that you need to either connect to your computer or your phone charger. It really should come with its own plug.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Brown

customer_reviews.title: Oh so portable with 3 light levels.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a personal light box. I was so surprised to get something as light and portable. I can prop it up on a 3-ring binder and work away in comfort on my 10 frame animation loop. I am using an opaque barrier to block the light outside the frame I'm drawing as the light is so intense (or white?) that eyestrain is a problem for me. Problem solved. A great product that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Great surprise!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was very surprised how thin this whole thing was! And the brightness is another great surprise! I remember how fun it was to use my father’s professional tracing table to create numerous pictures when I was growing up. Therefore, I have decided to get one for my 8 year old child and she loves using this portable tracing pad. We have just received this in our mail today, so I will see how it will hold up the use which I hope it will for a long time. One thing- a paper holder is a bit hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: N T

customer_reviews.title: Worked only one time.

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy how there are three different light setting

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but...

customer_reviews.title: I love how lightweight it is and how easy it is ...

The paper holder included is really helpful too. I'm really surprised I could get such a quality light box for a such an affordable price.

customer_reviews.title: So bright, slender and easy to use! Great for tracing templates on plastic - even if thick

Can be attached to your computer or plugged into the wall - super easy to use anywhere you can set down a laptop - and has 3 brightness levels. Folded paper or even template plastic - it shines right through. Nice little clip included to hold everything in place while tracing. Well worth the money!

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually leave reviews because nothing tends to wow me but I bought this lightbox because I suddenly wanted to learn to draw and I wanted something affordable but that would really work. I am THRILLED with this product. I am by no means an art expert or even an artist but this is so easy to use. You can plug it into the wall or your computer there are three easy to use levels of brightness and it’s incredibly lightweight and easy to get around. It does in some ways look a bit cheap but sometimes simplicity is best!! I’d definitely recommend buying this and I would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Every other light board that we could find had a plug-in for the USB connector in the frame. And the previous one we had failed from the constant plugging and unplugging of the cord. This company has manufactured a light board that rectifies this issue with a 6" patch cord that is permanently attached to the light board. They also supply a cord that can either be plugged into a computer or a 110 volt wall outlet. They back it up with a 5 year warranty, what product has a 5 year warranty these days??? Needless to say my wife is very pleased with the board and she religiously uses it for her Diamond Painting projects.

Great purchase, great price, great warranty.

customer_reviews.text: I got these for my kids (10-7) for Christmas. Like all gifts I opened them when they came in the mail to check and see if they worked or were broke. Thoughts were that the light is really bright on the highest setting, the red piece they give you to hold the paper DO NOT USE because it will scratch the screen the first time, they do look nice but seem very fragile. I’ve never used them before so this just might be how they all are. I’m 50/50 on being comfortable they will last awhile. I will roll the dice and keep them just bc I think my kids will like them a lot.
